result.execSummary:
The defendant Theodore G Reese was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Carry Concealed Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.23(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: *The Court orders the defendant to pay all applicable mandatory costs, fees, surcharges (including DNA), and assessments within 60 days (by 1-15-16) or any remaining balance to convert civil judgment.
Consecutive to: TO 15CM2202. Straight Time. NO HUBER RELEASE OR ELECTRONIC MONITORING ALLOWED.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Theodore G Reese

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Order signed and filed.

The defendant's motion or request for release privileges/additional release privileges is denied.
The court intended the defendant to serve the sentence without release privileges.
Per Order of Presiding Judge, Misdemeanor Division, this motion/request is hereby assigned to Reserve Branch 21, for review. mag
Defendant's pro se request for Huber privileges in 15CM001855 and 15CM002202.
Court signed order Denying defendant's request for release on electronic monitoring or reduction of sentence. Copies sent to the parties. lr
Per Order of Presiding Judge, Misdemeanor Division, this motion/request is hereby assigned to Reserve Branch 21, for review. spc
Defendant's pro se letter request for electronic monitoring or sentence reduction.

Defendant Theodore G Reese in court with Attorney Jessica Bellows.  
Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Matter before the Court for Sentencing.  Hearing proceeded.  Statements made by the state, defense, and defendant.

COUNT 1:  The Court orders the defendant to serve 8 MONTHS in the House of Correction STRAIGHT TIME with 0 credit, CONSECUTIVE TO 15CM002202.  NO HUBER RELEASE OR ELECTRONIC MONITORING ALLOWED.

The Court orders the defendant to pay all applicable mandatory costs, fees, surcharges (including dna), and assessments within 60 days (by 1-15-16) or any remaining balance to convert civil judgment.

Defendant Theodore G Reese in court with attorney Jessica Bellows.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  The State made disclosure on the record.  Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  Sentencing hearing proceeded.  Statements by State.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing to allow defense counsel time to discuss statements made by the State with the defendant.  Court ordered the defendant to possess no weapons.  Court ordered the defendant to submitt a DNA sample.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 24.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 16, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Theodore G Reese in court with attorney Jessica Bellows.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case calendared for plea/sentencing. Newly appointed counsel in court. Discovery and offer provided. Case adjourned in branch 24.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 28, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Theodore G Reese in court with attorney Torrie R. Williams.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Discussions of discovery placed on the record. Court ordered State to provide discovery to defense. Defense requests an adjourned Plea and Sentencing date. Court grants defense request. Case adjourned to branch 24.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 23, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Theodore G Reese in court with attorney Torrie R. Williams.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 24. lr  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for 08-26-2015 at 01:30 pm.

No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Theodore G Reese in court with attorney Joel H. Rosenthal.  Defendant Theodore G Reese in custody.  Zachary A Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Protasiewicz, Branch 24.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 16, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
